instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD_R: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD_R? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD. When you see ALL_SYS_PWRGD_R, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.CHGR_PHASE: What is CHGR_PHASE? CHGR_PHASE is charger voltage chopped up into individual slices prior to smoothing where it becomes PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG? This is battery power that flows to the system AFTER it has gone through a current sense resistor, before it goes through a fuse to become PPBUS_G3H power rail. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD0V: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD0V? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD When you see ALL_SYS_PWRGD0V, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
Hey buddy, I've got this mac that's been repaired, the <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> has been replaced and components next to it. In the tests the safe is swaying in green and orange and the cooler does not rotate.


Voltage: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.60V; <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.41V; <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD_R</SIGNAL> 0V; oscillates (<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> 0 ~ 1.2V; <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> 0V ~ 3.42).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
Surely no pulse at all at <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>?
Which other big coils pulse, apart of L7520?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD0V</SIGNAL>;


L7130 <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG</SIGNAL> / <SIGNAL>CHGR_PHASE</SIGNAL> 8,56 / 8,74 V
L7520 <SIGNAL>P5V_S4RS3_REG_L</SIGNAL> / <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> 0V
L7560 <SIGNAL>P3V3_S5_REG_L</SIGNAL> / <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_REG_R</SIGNAL> 1.7 ~ 3.2V oscilando
L7430 <SIGNAL>PDDR_S3_REG_L</SIGNAL> / <SIGNAL>PPDDR_S3_REG_R</SIGNAL> 0,02V
L7630 <SIGNAL>P1V05S0_LL</SIGNAL> / <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_REG_R</SIGNAL> 0.02V
L7310 <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU_PH1</SIGNAL> / <SIGNAL>CPUVR_PHASE1</SIGNAL> 0v
L7320 <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU_PH2</SIGNAL> / <SIGNAL>CPUVR_PHASE2</SIGNAL> 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
Please, find a better way to translate your messages, if you need help.
I cannot help properly, if I cannot understand your messages.

What this really means???
"the safe is swaying in green and orange"
Do you get steady orange light?
Probably not (nut not sure) and check <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.
If not steady high, you still have problems around <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>; post its voltages...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: sorry, i'm looking for other translators to make my problem easier to understand.  "the safe is swaying in green and orange".  it means that the led light is oscillating between green and red. when i get to the service i will check <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.  I apologize again for not being able to translate Portuguese to English correctly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3.31V
<CHIP>U5110</CHIP>:
1- 3,42V
2- GND
3- 3,43V
4- 2.94V
5 - 3,27V
6- 3,41V
7 - 3,42V
8 - 2,95V.

When you trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> the magsafe light turns green.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
"When you trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> the magsafe light turns green."
Looks like SMC reset.
Are you working with the board alone on the desk?
Disconnect trackpad and use <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 pads instead...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
''Are you working with the board alone on the desk? ''
only with the bench plate.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is steady high, when you trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: When you trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> , the voltage <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> remains high.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: Magsafe light still switch from orange to green then?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
"Magsafe light still switch from orange to green then?" no, it stabilized. after I checked it had broken tracks near <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>, the magsafe light stabilized. 
I noticed that <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> is between 0V and 1V oscillating and the <CHIP>U7840</CHIP> component is oxidizing, will it be the defect ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
You must clean/replace each oxidized component.

<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is now stable?
Post again voltages, after you've got Magsafe light steady.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> instable
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 61771, member: 682"]
You must clean/replace each oxidized component.
[/QUOTE]
okay

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: Post <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> basic voltages; pins 23, 12, 13, 22, 29, 21.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
23- oscillates between 8.55 and 8.59V
12 - oscillating, I can't know what value
13- oscillating tb between 1.7 and 0.9V
22- 3.28V
29 - oscillating between 4 and 3.7V
21- oscillating between 1.7 and 3.3V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
Did you eliminate all the corrosion?
Also replace affected components...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: had oxidized components near the SMC, I'm going to do the SMC reball.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: Always reball SMC, when you detect liquid sign around it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: resolved after running the SMC again, on the first attempt, I think there was a missing component sold, because it gave 8.18V in the PPBUS, I redid it again as sold and solved.  Thank you friend !!!
